text:
Hi, I'm Jake Burns, Enterprise
Strategist with AWS.

Cloud computing is the on-demand
delivery of IT resources

over the internet with pay-as-you-go
pricing.

Instead of maintaining
your own servers and data centers,

with the cloud you can procure
IT resources on demand

as a service, and pay only for
what you use.

The cloud can help your organization
innovate faster by allowing

you to focus your IT resources
on developing applications

that differentiate
your business and transform
customer experiences.

In the cloud, you can provision
thousands of servers in minutes,

and access services that you
can put together and use however
you want.

This allows your organization
to get from idea to implementation

far faster than what’s possible
in a traditional data center.

It also dramatically
simplifies IT capacity planning.

Instead of over provisioning
data center infrastructure

in order to ensure you have
enough capacity to handle

your business operations
at your peak level of activity,

with the cloud, you’re able
to provision exactly what you

need, when you need it, and instantly
scale up or down with the needs
of your business.

When you stop using a resource,
or if it turns out you need

less of it, you can give it back
to us and stop paying for it.

This allows you to reduce
your IT costs while at the same

time ensuring you always have
the capacity you need to serve
your customers.

With AWS, you’re able to deploy
these services globally,

with access to 99 Availability
Zones within 31 geographic
Regions around the world.

Our scale allows significantly
more investment in security

policing and countermeasures
than almost any large company
could afford themselves.

With core infrastructure
built to satisfy the security

requirements for military,
global banks, and other high-sensitivity

organizations, AWS has been
architected to be the most flexible

and secure cloud computing
environment available today.
